name: Union Winter Roller Express
description:
For the fourth year in a row, we're back bringing the crowd-favourite Roller Express! It's the perfect way to kick off Toronto's festive season.

Enjoy indoor roller-skating with skate rentals available on site and special themed nights like the Union Beats Skate Night, Winter Mixers, Roll and Recharge and skating lessons - all in the beautiful historic Union Station! 

Most events are open to guests of all ages. Please visit our website for more details.

 Children ages 12 and under will need to be supervised by a parent or guardian, who can also provide their physical ID to rent skates on behalf of the child. 

Guests ages 16 and under require a parent or guardian to sign their participation waiver.

name: Festive Card Printing at Mackenzie House
description:
Experience how holiday cards were created in a 19th century printshop, while learning about the history of early printing. Choose pictures from the Mackenzie House image collection to create a unique card to celebrate the season. Print your own card to take home on the historic printing press.

Note: The historic house is currently unfurnished, awaiting restoration. It can still be viewed by guided tour.

name: Tina Turner Tribute with Quisha Wint and Friends
description:
Honouring the inspirational legacy of Tina Turner, Queen of Rock 'n' Roll and one of the world's best-selling artists of all time.

One of our city's most powerful vocalists, Quisha Wint, with an all-star band, will take you on a journey from the start of Tina's career beginning in the mid-fifties right up to the modern era. 

Also featuring special guest Toronto jazz soul man Justin Bacchus alongside a seven-piece high energy band featuring Paul Antonio on drums, Roger Williams on bass, Joe Palawan on keys and Duff Musiq on guitar. With background vocalists Joanne Harris and Jelly.  Featured special guest is Robert Ball.

name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

location.name: The Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre

description:
Toronto's Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.

name: Shab-e She'r (Poetry Night) Thirteenth Anniversary
description:
Celebrate with us! 

Featured poets include Jumoke Verissimo and Richard Greene. There will be an Open Mic opportunity for poetry of any language.

name: Holiday Smalls Group Show
description:
Just in time for the holidays! 

Browse through 120 pieces of original art by 85 different artists! All pieces are 12" by 12".
